interlinear-text.item: Bibinoz Ajzatulloeva, 15 y.o., Vrang village. Recorded in 1965.
Pakhalina, T.N. 1975. Vakhanskii iazyk. Moscow: Nauka. p.175-178.

phrase.item: The sun is in the zenith
I am just babbling,
Inside I am run through with a knife
Not clear if first word is maʐ, could also be bə=
A string of beads (like) little hailstones.
Dally (at least) for a little while,
Your girlfriend will pour her soul out to you!
Black is your stallion, give your stallion a wide expanse [your] girl-friend will come out to look at you!
A red teakettle.
I swear by god, I like you better than my own self.
The weather is foul and cold.
O, if I were to turn into a sorceress, I'd plant a seed of wistful ache in you!
Daisies I've got two, Don't come with empty hands! (To come) with nothing [would be a] disgrace (for you)
I rose up so high, When I glance below Oh, how high I've climbed!
Embroidered bag.
When someone goes to the village
tell mother, your daughter is sad!
Cattle on that slope.
I am tired [female speaker] tired, (but) there's color on (my) face
You've got boots on your feet. Where oh where is my sweetheart? My sweetie is in Kulyaba, in the shade.
Red pendants
If you acknowledge me as your lover send me word!
Embroidered headpiece.
My eyes have looked and looked, Looked and looked, there's no [more] life for me.
I crossed over the irrigation ditch.
O, if I would turn into a dappled partridge I would jump into my sweetheart's embrace!
Pollen from qurut.
If someone would bring me news of my sweetie, my sweetie I'd come outside to meet.
Iron walking staff.
In the summer I set out (on a journey), In the winter, god is my aid.
The sun is setting.
I remained in the desert, Who cares about me?
